gurmukhi: As kiRpwn KMfo KVg sYP qyg qrvwr ]r`C kro hmrI sdw kvcwNqk krvwr ]10]
transliteration: As Kridaan Khando Khadag Saiph Teg Tarvaar|| Rachchh Daro Hamrisadaa Kavchaantak Karvaar||10||
translation: O Lord ! Protect us by smashing the armour with the blows of Thy hands with the help of As, Kripaan (sword), Khanda, Kharag, Saif, Tegh, and Talwaar (sword).10.

gurmukhi: quhI ktwrI dwVH jm qUM ibCUE Aru bwn ]qo piq pd jy lIjIAY r`C dws muih jwnu ]11]
transliteration: Tuhikataaridaadh Jam Toon Bichhodho Ar(u) Baan|| To Par(i) Pad Je Leejeeai Rachchh Daas Muhe Jaan(u)||11||
translation: Thou art Kataari, Jamdaadh, Bichhuaa and Baan, O power ! I am a serf of Thy Lordâ€™s feet, kindly Protect me.11.

gurmukhi: bwNk b`jR ibCUE quhI qbr qrvwr ]quhI ktwrI sYhQI krIAY r`C hmwr ]12]
transliteration: Baank Bajjra Bichhodho Tuhituhitabar Tarvaar|| Tuhikataarisaihathdareeai Rachchh Hamaar||12||
translation: Thou art Baank, bajar, Bichhuaa, Tabar, and Talwaar, Thou art the kataari, and Saihathi; Protect me.12.

gurmukhi: qumI gurj qumhI gdw qumhI qIr quPMg ]dws jwn morI sdw r`Cw kro srbMg ]13]
transliteration: Toumiguraj Toum-higadaa Toum-hiteer Touphan|| Daas Jaan Morisadaa Rachchhaaddaro Sarban||13||
translation: Thou art Gurj, Gadaa (mace), Teer (arrow) and Tufang; protect me ever considering me as Thy slave.13.

gurmukhi: CurI klm irp krd Bin KMjr bugdw nwie ]ArD irjk sB jgq ko muih qum lyhu bcwie ]14]
transliteration: Chhurikalam Rip Karad Bhan(i) Khanjar Bougdaa Naae|| Ardh Rijak Sabh Jagad Ko Muhe Toum Lehu Bachaae||14||
translation: Thou art the Chhurri, the enemy-killing karad and the Khanjar (dagger) are Thy names; Thou art the adorable Power of the world, kindly protect me.14.

gurmukhi: piRQm aupwvhu jgq qum qumhIN pMQ bnwie ]Awp quhI Jgrw kro qumhI kro shwie ]15]
transliteration: Pritham Oupaavoh Jagad Toum Toum-heen Panth Banaae|| Aap Tuhijhagraa Daro Toum-hidaro Sahaae||15||
translation: Firstly Thou createst the world, and then the Paths; then Thou crreatest the disputes and also help them.15.

gurmukhi: m`C k`C bwrwh qum qum bwvn Avqwr ]nwr isMG bauDw quhIN quhIN jgq ko swr ]16]
transliteration: Machchh Kachchh Baaraah Toum Toum Baavan Avtaar|| Naar Singh Baudhaa Tuheen Jagad Ko Saar||16||
translation: Thou art Machh (fish incarnation), Kachh (tortoise incarnation) and Varaha (the boar incarnation); Thou art also the Dwarf incarnation; Thou art also narsingh and Buddha and Thou art the Essence of the whole world.16.

gurmukhi: quhIN rwm sRI kiRSn qum quhIN ibSn ko rUp ]quhIN pRjw sB jgq kI quhIN Awp hI BUp ]17]
transliteration: Tuheen Raam Srikrishan Toum Toubeen Bishan Ko Roop|| Tougeen Prajaa Sabh Jagad Kituheen Aap Hibhoop||17||
translation: Thou art Rama, Krishna and Vishnu; Thou art the subjects of the whole world and Thou art also the Sovereign.17.

gurmukhi: quhIN ibpR CqRI quhIN quhIN rMk Aru rwau ]Swm dwm Aru fMf qUM qumhI Byd aupwau ]18]
transliteration: Tuheen Bipra Chhatrituheen Tuheen Rank Ar(u) Raao|| Shaam Daam Ar(u) Dand Toon Toum-hibhed Oupaao||18||
translation: Thou art the Brahmin, Kshatriya, the king and the poor; Thou art also Sama, Sama, Dand and Bhed and also other remedies.18.

gurmukhi: sIs quhIN kwXw quhIN qYN pRwnI ky pRwn ]qYN ibdXw jg bkqR huie kry byd bKXwn ]19]
transliteration: Sees Tuheen Kaayaa Tuheen Tain Praanike Praan|| Taeen Bidyaa Jag Baktra Hue Dare Bed Bakhyaan||19||
translation: Thou art the head, trunk and the life-force of all the creatures; the whole world imbibes all the learning from Thee and elucidates the Vedas.19.

gurmukhi: ibisK bwn DnuKwgR Bn sr kYbr ijh nwm ]qIr KqMg qqwrcy sdw kro mm kwm ]20]
transliteration: Bisikh Baan Dhanoukhaagra Bhan Sar Kaibar Jih Naam|| Teer Khatan Tataarche Sadaa Mam Kaam||20||
translation: Thou art the significant arrow fitted in the bow and Thou art also called the warrior Kaibar; O Thou called by various names of the arrows ! You may also do my job.20.

gurmukhi: qYxIrwlY SqR Air miRg AMqk ss bwn ]qum bYrx pRQmY hno bhuro bjY kiRpwn ]21]
transliteration: Taineeraalai Shattra Ar(i) Mrig Antak Sas Baan|| Toum Bairan Prathmai Hano Bahuro Bajai Kridaan||21||
translation: Thy house is the quiver and Thou killest like deer the enemies by becoming the shaft-power; Thy reality is that Thou killest the enemies beforehand and the sword strikes later on.21.

gurmukhi: qum pwts pwsI prs prm isMD kI Kwn ]qy jg ky rwjw Bey dIA qv ijh brdwn ]22]
transliteration: Toum Paatas Paasiparas Param Sindh Kikhaan|| Te Jag Ke Raajaa Bhae Deea Tav Jih Bardaan||22||
translation: Thou art the axe which tears away the enemies and also Thou art the noose, which binds down; Thou art Supremely Enduring One also; on whomsoever Thou didst bestow the boon, Thou didst make him the king of the world.22.

gurmukhi: sIs SqR Air AirAwr Ais KMfo KVg kiRpwn ]SkR surysr qum kIXo Bgiq Awpuno jwn ]23]
transliteration: Sees Shatra Ar(i) Ariaar As(i) Khando Khadag Kridaan|| Shakra Suresar Toum Keeyo Bhagad(i) Aapouno Jaan||23||
translation: Thou art the sword and dagger chopping the enemies and considering Indra as Thy devotee; Thou didst bestow on him the position of the king of gods.23.
